snippet: British researchers who created a “literary misery index”concluded that the emotional mood of literature reflected the mood of the economy over the previous 10 years.
abstract: British researchers who created a 'literary misery index' conclude that the emotional mood of literature reflected the mood of the economy over the previous 10 years; study appears in journal PLoS One.
lead_paragraph: British researchers who created a “literary misery index”concluded that the emotional mood of literature reflected the mood of the economy over the previous 10 years.

headline.main: Why Wasn’t It ‘Grapes of Glee’? Study of Books Finds Economic Link
headline.print_headline: Why Wasn’t It ‘Grapes of Glee’? Study of Books Finds Economic Link
